channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Stromboli: One dead as volcano erupts on Italian island
item.description: The victim was reportedly killed while hiking towards the volcano's summit.

item.title: Wolf Pack ruling: New Spain sex attack trial reignites rape law debate
item.description: Six youths are accused of sexually abusing a girl of 14 in Spain but may face the graver charge of rape.

item.title: MEPs choose David-Maria Sassoli as new European Parliament president
item.description: Centre-left former journalist David Sassoli is selected as the new speaker of the 28-member bloc.

item.title: Russia says details of fatal submersible fire are 'state secret'
item.description: A spokesman for Vladimir Putin says details about 14 deaths aboard a navy vessel are "totally classified".

item.title: Amsterdam mayor seeks red light closures
item.description: The proposed changes are the biggest in the city's sex trade in two decades.

item.title: ASAP Rocky arrested in Sweden on suspicion of assault
item.description: The rapper has been held on suspicion of aggravated assault after a fight in Stockholm.

item.title: Florijana Ismaili: Tributes paid after body of missing Swiss player is found
item.description: Tributes are paid to Switzerland forward Florijana Ismaili after the missing footballer's body is found.

item.title: Italy migrant rescue boat: Captain Carola Rackete freed
item.description: Carola Rackete, who works for a charity, is found not guilty of endangering lives after hitting a boat.

item.title: French village remembers WW2 SAS hero
item.description: French villagers remember a 24-year-old Welshman who was bludgeoned to death by the SS.

item.title: Tesco faces Brexit deadline headache
item.description: The retail giant's boss says an October Brexit could cause problems as it's too close to Christmas.

item.title: Climate change: Heatwave made 'at least' five times more likely by warming
item.description: The record heat experienced across Europe last week was made much more likely by rising temperatures say researchers.

item.title: Mount Elbrus: Irish climber Alan Mahon dies during descent
item.description: Alan Mahon, 40, from County Kildare, died while descending Mount Elbrus, Europe's highest peak.

item.title: Von der Leyen nomination: Germans criticise 'backroom deal'
item.description: Political opponents are threatening to block Ursula von der Leyen's nomination as Commission president.

item.title: Bosnian children fight back against segregation in schools
item.description: After the Bosnian wars of the 1990s, Bosnian schools widely operate a policy of two schools under one roof.

item.title: Ursula von der Leyen: Merkel ally nominated for EU top job
item.description: The defence minister emerged from the shadows as the leaders' nominee to replace President Jean-Claude Juncker.

item.title: Christine Lagarde: The 'rock star' of finance
item.description: Christine Lagarde is on track to become the first woman to run the European Central Bank.

item.title: The anti-corruption case that touched a Russian nerve
item.description: Journalist Ivan Golunov was falsely accused of drug-dealing - and Russians rallied to his cause.

item.title: EU-Swiss share trading row: What does it mean?
item.description: The EU and Switzerland are at loggerheads over share trading, but why and what does it mean?

item.title: Greek election: Why frustrated young voters are turning conservative
item.description: As Greece goes to the polls on 7 July, many young Greeks are turning from the left-wing Syriza.

item.title: How rude service inspired a multi-million euro firm
item.description: A bad experience at a shop inspired one man to set up a business that measures customer satisfaction.

item.title: Berlin Brandenburg: The airport with half a million faults
item.description: Billions over budget, years late in opening, and still being rebuilt before a single plane has landed. What's gone so wrong at the new Berlin airport?

item.title: Middlesbrough: Where heroin is cheaper than cigarettes
item.description: The true scale of homelessness in the North East is largely hidden from view, according to Shelter.

item.title: The pupils speaking out against segregation in schools
item.description: Several dozen schools in Bosnia are split in two, teaching youngsters according to their ethnicity.

item.title: Latvia PM urges good balance in EU top jobs
item.description: Nominees for the top EU jobs must be a balance of nations and gender, Latvia's PM says.

item.title: Tusk promises 'consistent EU leadership on Brexit'
item.description: European Council leader Donald Tusk says he is sure the next team of EU leaders will be as united as the existing one.

item.title: Ukraine's landmines endangering children
item.description: Unexploded mines and rockets are one of the legacies of Ukraine's conflict with Russia-backed separatists.

item.title: Jeremy Hunt would no-deal Brexit 'with a heavy heart’
item.description: The Tory leadership contender says he would support companies damaged by leaving the EU without a deal.

item.title: The teenager with Down's syndrome swimming in the Arctic
item.description: Trym is the first person to live on the Svalbard Islands with Down's syndrome and he isn't letting it hold him back.
